body_html:
When filing issues, please do fill out the New Issue Template - in particular the details about the version number used, instructions to reproduce etc are helpful when diagnosing a problem.

That said, with the snippet provided, nothing obvious sticks out. Though, I notice that you're using tf.train.Supervisor, which was something that predates TensorFlow 1.0. Since TensorFlow 1.0 we've been recommending the use of MonitoredTrainingSession. Is it possible for you to use that instead? See the guide on distributed TensorFlow at: https://www.tensorflow.org/deploy/distributed

body:
When filing issues, please do fill out the [New Issue Template](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/new) - in particular the details about the version number used, instructions to reproduce etc are helpful when diagnosing a problem.

That said, with the snippet provided, nothing obvious sticks out. Though, I notice that you're using `tf.train.Supervisor`, which was something that predates TensorFlow 1.0. Since TensorFlow 1.0 we've been recommending the use of `MonitoredTrainingSession`. Is it possible for you to use that instead? See the guide on distributed TensorFlow at: https://www.tensorflow.org/deploy/distributed
